Class RemoteException

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Throwable
      java.lang.Exception
          com.mapmyfitness.android.mmfremoteappexample.app.com.mapmyfitness.android.mmfremote.RemoteException
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class RemoteException
extends java.lang.Exception

This exception is thrown for 3 reasons. The reason can be accessed via the getCode() method. These are:

  • The app is not connected, and you called a method that requires it.
  • The app is connected, and you called a method that requires it be disconnected.
  • If you try to build the RemoteManager without passing it a android.content.Context
Methods that throw this are documented.

See Also:
